title: People & Relationships
objectives: Combine topics with 은/는 and subjects with 이/가
context: Talking about family, friends, and coworkers is everyday conversation.
Possessive 제/제 친구 adds warmth and clarity when introducing people.
Particles help mark who we're talking about and who is acting.
explanation: 제 is the polite 'my' (from 저 + 의). Use 내 for casual. 제 친구, 제 부모님 are safer than 내 with new people.
당신 is rarely used in conversation except between spouses or in customer service. Use 이름+씨 (e.g., 민수 씨) to say 'you.'
은/는 sets the topic (제 친구는...), 이/가 marks the subject (동료가...). Both can appear in one sentence if needed.
For respect toward elders/parents, use honorific verbs like 계시다 (to be/exist honorifically) instead of 있다: 부모님이 계세요.
To introduce someone: 이쪽은 제 친구 민수예요 = This is my friend Minsu.

messages.speaker: 수진
messages.korean: 안녕하세요! 저는 선생님 수진이에요. 만나서 반갑습니다.
messages.english: Hello! I'm teacher Sujin. Nice to meet you.
messages.romanization: annyeonghaseyo! jeoneun seonsaengnim sujin-ieyo. mannaseo bangapseumnida.

messages.speaker: 서연
messages.korean: 안녕하세요, 선생님. 저는 서연이에요. 제 남편 준호예요.
messages.english: Hello, teacher. I'm Seoyeon. This is my husband Junho.
messages.romanization: annyeonghaseyo, seonsaengnim. jeoneun seoyeon-ieyo. je nampyeon junho-yeyo.

messages.speaker: 준호
messages.korean: 안녕하세요. 민호는 제 친구예요. 제 동료예요.
messages.english: Hello. Minho is my friend. He's my coworker.
messages.romanization: annyeonghaseyo. minhoneun je chingu-yeyo. je dongnyo-yeyo.

messages.speaker: 서연
messages.korean: 네, 제 가족은 서울에 있어요. 부모님도 서울에 있어요.
messages.english: Yes, my family is in Seoul. My parents are in Seoul too.
messages.romanization: ne, je gajogeun seoure isseoyo. bumonimdo seoure isseoyo.

messages.speaker: 준호
messages.english: Dear, our child is at home.

messages.speaker: 민호
messages.korean: 네, 제 아내 있어요. 지금 집에 있어요.
messages.english: Yes, I have a wife. She's at home now.
messages.romanization: ne, je anae isseoyo. jigeum jibe isseoyo.
